title: Automotive Mechanic Terms
description: Rev up your knowledge with this quiz about the vocabulary used by auto mechanics and technicians.

questions.question: What is a 'catalytic converter'?
options: A device that converts gas to electric power
A part of the fuel injection system
A type of car battery
An exhaust system component that reduces harmful emissions by converting toxic gases into less harmful substances

questions.question: What does 'alignment' refer to in auto repair?
options: Adjusting the angles of the wheels so they are set to the manufacturer's specifications for optimal handling
Arranging tools in the shop
Connecting the engine to the transmission
Lining up cars in a parking lot

questions.question: What is a 'timing belt'?
options: A speedometer component
A seat belt timer
A belt that synchronizes the rotation of the crankshaft and camshaft so engine valves open and close at the proper times
A belt worn by racing drivers

questions.question: What does 'torque' mean in automotive terms?
options: The weight of the engine
The top speed of a vehicle
The total horsepower
A rotational force that measures an engine's twisting power

questions.question: What is a 'differential' in a vehicle?
options: A type of brake system
The price difference between repairs
A gear assembly that allows the drive wheels to rotate at different speeds, especially when turning
The difference between two car models

questions.question: What does 'OBD' stand for?
options: Overhead Belt Drive
On-Board Diagnostics
Outer Body Damage
Original Brake Design

questions.question: What is the 'alternator' responsible for?
options: Alternating between gears
Generating electrical power to charge the battery and power the vehicle's electrical systems while the engine runs
Managing the turn signals
Controlling the air conditioning

questions.question: What does 'camber' refer to in wheel alignment?
options: The direction the wheels point
The rotation speed of the tires
The inward or outward tilt of the wheel when viewed from the front of the vehicle
The distance between the front wheels

questions.question: What is a 'head gasket'?
options: A gasket on the gas cap
A rubber seal around the headlights
The top cover of the engine
A seal between the engine block and cylinder head that prevents oil and coolant from mixing

questions.question: What does 'ABS' stand for in automotive terms?
options: Anti-lock Braking System
Automatic Braking System
Advanced Battery Service
Air Bag Sensor

questions.question: What is a 'CV joint'?
options: A constant velocity joint that transmits power from the transmission to the wheels while allowing for suspension movement
A joint in the car's frame
The connection between the cabin and the engine
A joint in the convertible top mechanism

questions.question: What does 'compression ratio' indicate?
options: How compressed the car's suspension is
The ratio of the cylinder volume at the bottom of the piston stroke to the volume at the top
The fuel efficiency rating
The air pressure in the tires

questions.question: What is 'hydroplaning'?
options: Polishing a car's surface with water
A method of engine cooling
When tires lose traction by riding on a layer of water instead of gripping the road surface
A type of car wash

questions.question: What does a 'serpentine belt' do?
options: Secures the battery in place
Connects the steering wheel to the front wheels
A single continuous belt that drives multiple engine accessories like the alternator, power steering pump, and AC compressor
Holds the exhaust system in place

questions.question: What is 'detonation' or 'engine knock'?
options: Uncontrolled combustion in the engine cylinder that can damage engine components
The sound of a cold engine starting
The engine shutting off
The sound of worn brake pads
